comment.body:
Having a snowy yule in Helsinki is a bit of a gamble and according to FMI between 2006-2023 the probability is just 44% and the minimum definition White Christmas is quite a stretch from the full blown Winter Wonderland. 

Come back in late January or go north. Or go back in time 50 years or so.
That's called climate change. Try Lapland.

For snow and freezing temperatures you'll have to move some hundred kilometers inland to the north.

See https://en.ilmatieteenlaitos.fi/ for the weather situation. As the "Snow depth" section shows, there is snow by just going some 50-100 km inland, but as the "Max temperature" section shows, you'll have to travel half-way up to Lapland through Finland in order to get out of melting temperatures (the yellow area).

There's not a lot of snow even in Lapland right now.

Actually looking at the Ilmatieteen laitos map (don't know how precise it is) there's more snow in Tampere than Rovaniemi.
